choices.C: Machine learning (ML), natural language processing (NLP), employee-led supervised learning, and no-code interface.
choices.D: Machine learning (ML), Robotics Process Automation (RPA), employee-led supervised learning, and no-code interface.
choices.B: Machine learning (ML), natural language processing (NLP), employee-led supervised learning, and custom development tools.
choices.A: Machine learning (ML), Robotics Process Automation (RPA), employee-led supervised learning, and custom development tools.

questions.question_text: Which solutions are combined within UiPath Communications Mining?
Why is working with the Low Confidence training mode important during the "Explore" phase in UiPath Communications Mining?

choices.D: Because it allows for the use of multiple sources of data despite the low confidence.
choices.A: Because it's providing training examples that have no confident informative label predictions, so reviewing these can help to significantly boost the model's coverage.
choices.C: Because the user can train underperforming labels on new examples that have high confidence.
choices.B: Because it enables the user to focus on the labels with low accuracy.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Training using 'Low confidence'
User permissions required: 'View Sources' AND 'Review and label'.

The final key step in Explore is training using 'Low confidence' mode, which shows you messages that are not well covered by informative label predictions. These messages will have either no predictions or very low confidence predictions for labels that the platform understands to be informative.

https://docs.uipath.com/communications-mining/automation-cloud/latest/user-guide/training-using-low-confidence

questions.question_text: Can you use Queues in the Document Understanding Process?

choices.C: The Document Understanding Process can use Queues but the Auto Retry Functionality should be enabled.
choices.D: The Document Understanding Process can't use Queues because items waiting for Human Validation for more than 24h will be marked as Abandoned.
choices.B: The Document Understanding Process can use Queues but the Auto Retry Functionality should be disabled.
choices.A: The Document Understanding Process can't use Queues because items waiting for Human Validation for more than 10 days will be marked as Abandoned.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
you shouldnt retry as waiting for validation

Selected Answer: B
Answer is correct

questions.question_text: What action can be performed when using the User Interface to update a UiPath Communications Mining entity?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
regarding update entities , In the Uipath documentation shows where you can update the entities is in Edit entity , the base general field is another Field in that tab.
The correct answer is A

Selected Answer: C
Here you can update the base general field, the title of the general field and the API name (these concepts are described in detail below), as well as making the general field 'trainable'.

Selected Answer: C
Asnwer is C: Here you can update the base entity

questions.question_text: How are the Number of Messages calculated in UiPath Communications Mining's thread analytics?

choices.C: It is calculated by counting the total number of participants in a conversation and assuming each participant sent one message.
choices.A: It is calculated by summing up the total number of words in all messages within a thread.
choices.B: It is calculated by counting the number of unique days on which messages were sent in the thread.
choices.D: It is calculated by taking a count of the number of messages that are part of the same thread.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Number of Messages
The platform will display the threaded volume by number of messages, as well as the top label volumes by number of messages.

The number of messages is calculated by taking a count of the number of messages that are part of the same thread.

https://docs.uipath.com/communications-mining/automation-cloud/latest/user-guide/using-reports
